item.title: 花旗和野村认为政治动荡给泰国发放现金带来风险
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. ）和野村控股公司（Nomura Holdings Inc.【原文：Rising Thai political uncertainty poses significant risks to Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin’s plan for a $13.6 billion cash handout to stimulate Southeast Asia’s second-largest economy, according to Citigroup Inc. and Nomura Holdings Inc.】

item.title: 经济软着陆意味着债券前路漫长而艰难
item.description: 欢迎收看《每周快讯》（Weekly Fix），这是一份总是充满趣味的时事通讯。我是彭博社亚洲市场直播团队负责人加菲尔德-雷诺兹。【原文：Welcome to the Weekly Fix, the newsletter that’s always full of interest. I’m Garfield Reynolds, Bloomberg’s Markets Live team leader in Asia.】

item.title: 愤怒、无聊和华尔街赌注如何造就了新一代美国年轻交易员
item.description:
摘自纳撒尼尔-波普尔即将出版的《华尔街巨魔》

。【原文：

An excerpt from Nathaniel Popper’s forthcoming The Trolls of Wall Street.

】

item.title: 欧洲央行降息前欧元区通胀率升幅超预期
item.description: 欧元区通胀加速超过预期—；这进一步给欧洲中央银行下周计划降息后的利率前景蒙上了阴影。【原文：Euro-area inflation accelerated more than anticipated — further clouding the outlook for European Central Bank interest rates after next week’s planned cut.】

item.title: 帕内塔称欧洲央行现在减息可避免日后 "迟缓仓促 "行动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员法比奥-帕内塔（Fabio Panetta）说，欧洲中央银行不应该推迟降息，因为这样做最终只会迫使在稍后阶段采取更激烈的行动。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t delay interest-rate cuts because doing so can just end up forcing more drastic action at a later stage, Governing Council member Fabio Panetta said.】

item.title: 摩根大通正在洽谈为 Logan、KWG 安排 11 亿美元贷款事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is in talks to arrange a three-year loan of about HK$8.95 billion ($1.1 billion) for two distressed Chinese builders, according to people familiar with the matter, as the companies work to clear a restructuring hurdle.】

item.title: 更多关于人人谈论的纽约市问题办公楼的信息
item.description:
希腾-萨姆塔尼（Hiten Samtani）带我们参观了百老汇的不良房地产。【原文：

Hiten Samtani takes us on a tour of distressed Broadway real estate.

】

item.title: 德意志银行第二季度交易收入将下降
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）首席财务官詹姆斯-冯-莫尔特克（James von Moltke）表示，第二季度固定收益交易收入将出现下降，这将低于分析师的预期。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG Chief Financial Officer James von Moltke said that fixed-income trading revenue is set to drop in the second quarter, in what would be a miss of analysts’ expectations.】

item.title: 中国科技股走向技术性调整
item.description: 随着获利回吐和地缘政治不确定性的重现，中国科技股有望进入技术性调整。【原文：China’s technology stocks are on course to enter into a technical correction as profit-taking and renewed geopolitical uncertainties weigh on the gauge.】

item.title: 汇丰力争在七月前选定首席执行官奎因的继任者
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）正力争在未来几周内完成首席执行官人选的物色工作，该行倾向于从内部任命下一任老板。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc is pushing to wrap up the search for a chief executive officer in the coming weeks, with the bank edging toward appointing its next boss from within its own ranks.】

item.title: 土耳其经济在加息启动前出现井喷式增长
item.description: 今年年初，土耳其的经济增长速度加快，对一系列旨在抑制国内需求的激进加息措施保持了免疫力。【原文：Turkey’s economy grew at a faster pace to start the year, remaining immune to a series of aggressive interest-rate increases meant to muffle domestic demand.】

item.title: 法国通胀率今年首次因能源而加快
item.description: 就在欧洲中央银行准备降低利率之际，法国通胀率今年首次加速上升，反映了该地区其他国家的趋势。【原文：French inflation accelerated for the first time this year — mirroring trends elsewhere in the region just as the European Central Bank prepares to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国银行警告 "超老龄化 "韩国将失去魔力
item.description: 根据美国银行（Bank of America）的预测，随着人口老龄化削弱了国家的活力，并加强了经济的逆风，韩国的平均经济增长率将在 2030 年代降至 2% 以下。【原文：South Korea’s average economic growth rate will fall below 2% in the 2030s as aging demographics sap the nation’s vitality and strengthens headwinds for the economy, according to Bank of America projections.】

item.title: 阿美石油公司股票销售跻身自其首次公开募股以来全球规模最大的股票销售之列
item.description: 自五年前沙特将石油巨头阿美公司上市以来，沙特出让阿美公司的部分股份将筹集高达 120 亿美元的资金，是全球规模最大的股份出售交易之一。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s offer of a sliver of Aramco that will raise as much as $12 billion ranks among the largest share sales globally since the kingdom listed the oil giant five years ago.】

item.title: 英国房价三个月来首次上涨
item.description: 英国最大的抵押贷款机构之一表示，英国房价三个月来首次出现上涨，这是市场在借贷成本高企的情况下趋于稳定的一个迹象。【原文：UK house prices rose for the first time in three months, a sign that the market is stabilizing in the face of high borrowing costs, one of the biggest mortgage lenders said.】

item.title: 英国房价三个月来首次上涨
item.description: 英国伯明翰 Sutton Coldfield 地区的住宅物业。摄影师：Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg【原文：Residential properties in the Sutton Coldfield area of Birmingham, UK. Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg】

item.title: 一度高歌猛进的亚洲对冲基金 Mass Ave 同意接受美国证券交易委员会的罚款
item.description: 据监管机构称，Mass Ave Global Inc. 及其联合创始人 Winston Feng 因向其旗舰亚洲对冲基金的投资者 "做出虚假和误导性陈述"，同意支付合计 60 万美元的罚款，以了结美国证券交易委员会的诉讼。【原文：Mass Ave Global Inc. and its co-founder Winston Feng agreed to pay a combined $600,000 in fines to settle US Securities and Exchange Commission proceedings for “making false and misleading statements” to investors in its flagship Asia hedge fund, according to the regulator.】

item.title: 受天气波动影响，小麦创乌克兰战争以来最大涨幅
item.description: 四月份，乌克兰农民尤里-塞克（Yurii Sekh）期待着小麦丰收。然而，该地区有史以来最干旱的一个麦季让这些希望破灭了。这也导致主粮价格飙升，再次引发了对粮食成本上升的担忧。【原文：In April, Ukrainian farmer Yurii Sekh was looking forward to a good wheat harvest. One of the driest Mays in the region’s records dashed those hopes. It also sent prices for the staple grain soaring, reviving fears of rising food costs.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事欧洲
item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

】

item.title: 历史表明，印度股市往往在投票后回报投资者
item.description: 印度股市在下周大选结果公布前出现波动，但如果历史可以作为指引，那么大选结果对长期投资者来说差别不大。【原文：Indian stocks have turned volatile ahead of election results due next week, but if history is any guide the outcome makes little difference to long-term investors.】

item.title: 市场正在权衡截然不同的特朗普判决
item.description:
历史可能对拜登有利，但投注者首次将这位前总统的当选几率置于50%以上。【原文：

History may favor Biden, but bettors are putting the former president’s election chances above 50% for the first time. 

】

item.title: 联盟时代来临，希望与忧虑笼罩南非市场
item.description: 南非大选的结果让投资者在对联合政府可能采取的不同方案的焦虑和对无论联合政府采取何种方案都将产生一个对市场友好的政府的希望之间摇摆不定。【原文：Election results from South Africa have left investors swinging between anxiety over the different permuations that coalition may take and lingering hopes that whatever it is will result in a market-friendly government.】

item.title: 提前大选为今年伦敦市场增添看涨理由
item.description: 自 7 月 4 日大选宣布以来，英国资产大多横盘整理，但这并不妨碍市场参与者变得更加积极，因为反对党工党在民调中遥遥领先。【原文：UK assets have mostly traded sideways since the announcement of the July 4 election, but that hasn’t stopped market participants from becoming more positive, with the opposition Labour Party far ahead in the polls.】

item.title: 南非大选结果，55.6% 的选区获胜
item.description: 以上是南非选举委员会公布的南非全国大选最新核实结果。【原文：These are the latest verified results from South Africa’s national election, released by the Electoral Commission of South Africa.】

item.title: 大选焦虑将卢比波动的赌注推至九个月高点
item.description: 卢比的短期隐含波动率已飙升至九个月来的最高点，表明随着印度长达数周的大选进入最后阶段，人们的紧张情绪日益加剧。【原文：Short-term implied volatility in the rupee has spiraled to the highest in nine months, suggesting mounting nervousness as India’s weeks-long election enters its final stretch.】

item.title: 非洲街头货币交易商对抗政府
item.description: 出于保护本国货币的考虑，从南部的哈拉雷、东部的朱巴到西部的拉各斯，非洲的政策制定者们都在打击街头交易商。【原文：Out of options to defend their currencies, African policymakers from Harare in the south to Juba in the east and Lagos in the west are cracking down on street dealers.】

item.title: 中国加强对债券狂热的警告
item.description: 中国与押注政府债券涨势扩大的投资者的斗争升级，暗示央行可能会出售自己持有的部分债券，以冷却涨势。【原文：China escalated a battle against investors betting on an extended rally in government bonds, hinting the central bank may sell some of its own holdings to cool the advance.】

item.title: 印度股票套期保值成本四年来增幅最大
item.description: 在下周大选结果揭晓之前，印度股票套期保值成本创下了自 "科威德-19 "疫情爆发以来的最大涨幅。【原文：The cost of hedging Indian stocks has surged by the most since the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic ahead of the general election’s outcome next week.】

item.title: 消息称碧桂园寻求退出中国芯片制造商 CXMT
item.description: 中国房地产开发商碧桂园控股有限公司（Country Garden Holdings Co.【原文：As Chinese property developer Country Garden Holdings Co. struggles under a mountain of debt, its venture capital arm is considering selling its stake in a chipmaker that may become a target of US sanctions.】

item.title: 中国工厂活动萎缩，经济增长前景意外受挫
item.description: 中国的工厂活动在 5 月份意外萎缩，这是中国政府最依赖于推动经济增长的经济领域发出的一个警示信号。【原文：China’s factory activity unexpectedly contracted in May, a warning sign from the area of the economy that Beijing is most reliant on to drive growth.】
